meanings.definition: The slow movement of something along a surface.
meanings.sent1: The creepages of the snail fascinated the children at the park.
meanings.sent2: I noticed the creepages of the turtle as it made its way across the road.
meanings.sent3: The creepages of the caterpillar made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The creepages of the fog over the lake created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The creepages of the shadow on the wall seemed to come alive in the dim light.

meanings.definition: The act of behaving in a way that is considered strange or inappropriate.
meanings.sent1: His creepages at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to address the student's creepages in class.
meanings.sent3: The dog's creepages of chasing its tail always made us laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her creepages of wearing mismatched socks became her signature style.
meanings.sent5: The creepages of the robot trying to imitate human emotions were amusing to watch.

meanings.definition: The gradual increase in size or amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The creepages of the plant's leaves indicated its healthy growth.
meanings.sent2: I observed the creepages of the river as it swelled after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The creepages of the balloon getting bigger made the children excited.
meanings.sent4: The creepages of the crowd grew larger as more people arrived at the event.
meanings.sent5: The creepages of the snow on the mountain signaled the coming winter.
